newsitem.title: CHINA: PLO official says Netanyahu risks Mideast war.
newsitem.headline: PLO official says Netanyahu risks Mideast war.

text.p: Palestine Liberation Organisation (PLO) official Farouk Kaddoumi lashed out at Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday, saying he was risking pushing the Middle East towards war.

"He (Netanyahu) is complicating the whole issue and pushing the whole area to the state of war," Kaddoumi, the PLO political department chief or foreign minister, told a news briefing in the Chinese capital.
Kaddoumi said that calls for new Israeli settlements on the West Bank were a dangerous step and that Netanyahu was "living on the moon" if he thought his policies would succeed.
"What he is doing, he is committing certain sins when he asks Israelis to build new settlements," he said. "This is the most dangerous step that the government of Netanyahu has taken."

The PLO official was in China at the invitation of Vice-Premier and Foreign Minister Qian Qichen. During his visit, he met Qian and briefed the Chinese official on the impasse in the Mideast peace process.
